intro: Chamissoniophila stoechadifolia, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Europe and North Africa. It is characterized by its blue or violet flowers and silver-gray foliage, which help it withstand salty sea air. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline. It has a compact, bushy growth habit and is often used in coastal landscaping for its hardiness. Chamissoniophila stoechadifolia is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
